channel.description: Recent content in Hugo on DamNotes

item.title: Quick Reference
item.description: hugo new site site-name → create new project hugo version → check version installed hugo server → start local server on localhost:1313 hugo server -D → compile also drafts hugo → build the project hugo -D → build also drafts hugo new path/to/file.md → create new files in /content/ directory

item.title: Front Matter
item.description: Informations between the two --- is called front matter. draft: true → mark post as draft image: "static/path-to-image.jpeg" → set the default post image (usuallly placed in the static directory) tags: ['tag1', 'tag2'] → post tags categories: ['category1', ...] → post categories publishdate: → set a publishing date for the post (if the build date is previous the one indicated, the post will not be published)

item.title: Folder Structure
item.description: Archetypes Set the front matter for different content types. archetypes/default.md → default front matter for new content ---title:"{{ replace .Name "-" "" | title }}"date:{{.Date}}draft:true--- Config Used to store various different configurations. If the number of configuration is limited, one can just use a single config.toml file. Also .json and .yaml can be used. To see more about configurations and configure each site properly, visit this page Content Directory used to store all the text file for all the contents.

item.title: Content Organization
item.description: General Concepts Content should be organised in such a way to reflect the rendered site. Contents in the content directory can be nested at any level The top levels (i.e. content/<DIRECTORIES>) are considered the content type used to determine layouts etc. Here, baseurl = "https://example.com" is assumed in the config.toml file One can keep one _index.md for the homepage and one in each content sections, taxonomies, and taxonomy terms.

item.title: Themes
item.description: Add a theme as a submodule using git submodule add github-link themes/theme-name in the website root Hugo applies the decided theme first and then applies anything that is in the local directory. To set a theme, add theme= theme_name to the config.toml file. Create a Theme To create a new theme use hugo new theme theme-name

item.title: Functions
item.description: All functions are reported in the documentation. {{ .Site.Params.homeText | markdownify }} → access the site parameter homeText (in the config file) and apply the markdownify function {{ $css := "css/bootstrap.min.css" | absURL }} → define a variable and apply the absURL function {{ hugo.Generator }} → add in the html head to display the hufo version as a metadata in the source code String Manipulation {{ print SOMETHING }} → print the argument using the Golang print function.

item.title: Configuration File
item.description: It is possible to set different url permalink per section. See here for more informations [permalinks] blog = "/:filename/"
